sleep_index.title: Your Sleep Index trend over the last 3 weeks
sleep_index.description: The sleep index is designed to be one single metric you need to judge your sleep health, using several contributors like total sleep duration, resting HR, restfulness.

insights.description: Your overall sleep index has gone down compared to the previous week. Checkout which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

best_contributors.title: HR Drop
best_contributors.description: HR Drop is a measure of how soon your body is able to get in to a state of rest and recovery.

best_contributors.title: HRV Form
best_contributors.description: This metric represents the HRV trend across the duration of your sleep.

best_contributors.title: Timing
best_contributors.description: This represents the adherence to your Circadian Rhythm.

worst_contributors.title: Total Sleep
worst_contributors.description: It represents the volume of uninterrupted sleep every night for your body.

insights.title: How to improve Total Sleep?
insights.description: Optimum supplementation of magnesium is known to keep you asleep for longer.

worst_contributors.title: Temperature Deviation
worst_contributors.description: Your core temperature drops by a degree or two as just before and during sleep. And a few hours before you wake up again, it starts to rise. This is a measure of that deviation

insights.title: How to improve Temperature control?
insights.description: Lack of rest, illness or inflammation could lead to temperature elevation. Do brisk walks and prioritise rest when you see elevated temperatures.

worst_contributors.title: Restorative Sleep
worst_contributors.description: Restorative sleep is a measure of contributions of REM and Deep sleep.

insights.title: How to improve Restorative Sleep?
insights.description: It’s important to clear your head before going to sleep. The probability of restorative sleep increases when you have a relaxation routine before sleep.

recovery_index.title: Your Recovery Index trend over the last 3 weeks
recovery_index.description: The Recovery Score indicates your overall state of 'well-being'. It depends on markers like resting heart rate, hrv, temperature, sleep quality, movement and recovery.

insights.description: Your overall recovery index has been similar to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Movement Index
best_contributors.description: This represents your overall movement trends.

worst_contributors.title: Resting Heart Rate
worst_contributors.description: Put simply, the more efficient your heart becomes, the lower your resting heart rate gets.

insights.title: How to improve Resting Heart Rate?
insights.description: Sleep quality plays a major role in improving heart efficiency. On days you aren’t able to get quality sleep, try a 30 min Non-sleep deep rest protocol to improve restfulness and heart efficiency.

worst_contributors.title: Sleep Quotient
worst_contributors.description: Sleep quality and duration are factored into this metric.

insights.title: How to improve Sleep Quotient?
insights.description: Sleep discipline starts with setting a routine. Try to sleep and wake up at the same time even if you are not able to get enough sleep. This will help avoid fatigue due to lack of sleep.

worst_contributors.title: HRV Form
worst_contributors.description: This metric represents your HRV patterns and deviations which are indicators of your body's adaptability.

insights.title: How to improve HRV Form?
insights.description: Downtrending HRV beyond normal thresholds could happen due to lack of recovery or illness. Prioritize rest and low intensity exercise to improve this.

movement_index.title: Your Movement Index trend over the last 3 weeks
movement_index.description: The Movement Index is designed to keep you moving for optimal glucose metabolism and increase your non-exercise energy usage. Its a measure of how active you were that day.

insights.description: Your overall movement index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Workout Frequency
best_contributors.description: This metric counts the number of days you were really active and the number of workouts you did to add in a more long term measure of your activity.

best_contributors.title: Active Hours
best_contributors.description: The is a measure of how active you stay at least once per hour for more hours of the day.

best_contributors.title: Steps
best_contributors.description: This represents the number of steps you've taken and how you're comparing to what's expected based on your routine.

worst_contributors.title: Activity
worst_contributors.description: It's a measure of how much your body is working compared to when it's at rest.

insights.title: How to improve Activity?
insights.description: Plan a water and movement break every hour. This is a simple hack to ensure hydration and blood circulation.
